employees.notes: The accessible Proff page is for an underenhet ("GLASOPOR AS AVD OSLO") and shows "Ansatte 5"; a confirmed company-level headcount was not found in available sources. [1]

revenue.notes: Proff reports "Sum driftsinntekter 2024" as 138 458 with "Beløp i 1000", interpreted as NOK 138,458,000. [1]

company.entity_resolution_notes: Entity resolved as the Norwegian company Glasopor AS (org.nr 884344662). Proff shows the org number and an underenhet label, while permit application documents use the same organization number for Glasopor AS. [1][2]

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Glasopor AS uses recycled glass waste as a core inbound feedstock for foam-glass production. Permit documentation states receipt of recycled glass streams and ~55,000 tonnes in 2022 at Onsøy, while company material pages state 100% recycled glass packaging feedstock. [2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Recycled glass feedstock
srm_inputs.used_for: Recycled glass is crushed to fine powder and heat-processed (with activator) to produce foam glass used as lightweight fill and insulation material. [2]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: The input is described as fundamental to the product (foam glass made from recycled packaging glass), with substantial inbound quantity disclosed for Onsøy (about 55,000 t in 2022). [2][3]

main_quantity.context: The permit application states the Onsøy facility received about 55,000 tonnes of glass in 2022; this is a site-level inbound SRM amount. [2]

share.context: Company product information states foam glass is made from 100% recycled glass packaging; treated as feedstock share claim. [3]

srm_inputs.volume_notes: A direct mass figure is available for one site (Onsøy, 2022). No consolidated company-wide annual SRM input total was identified in available public sources. [2]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: Source material mix includes several recovered glass fractions, but publicly available sources do not provide fraction-by-fraction shares or latest company-wide totals. [2][3]

gaps_and_uncertainties: No audited, consolidated SRM input tonnage for all Glasopor AS operations (beyond disclosed Onsøy site data) was found. [2]
Employee count at legal-entity level could not be confirmed from accessible Proff content, which displayed underenhet information. [1]
